intro: Matricaria carnea, commonly known as the German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are used in herbal teas and as a natural remedy for various ailments. Matricaria carnea is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
